summary: This bill, the Re-Entry Support Through Opportunities for Resources and Essentials Act of 2025 (RESTORE Act), aims to amend the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996. It focuses on removing restrictions on SNAP (Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program) benefits for individuals with drug-related convictions. Specifically, it seeks to allow individuals with drug offenses to receive benefits, eliminates certain restrictions on temporary assistance, and modifies the definition of a household under SNAP to include incarcerated individuals scheduled for release within 30 days.
